snippet: The most rational way to rebuild the Yankees is to reconstruct a skeletal farm system, but with a deal near for the free-agent outfielder Jacoby Ellsbury, there seems to be no other option than to spend big.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column contends most rational way to rebuild New York Yankees is to reconstruct a skeletal farm system, but with a deal near for the free-agent outfielder Jacoby Ellsbury, there seems to be no other option than to spend big; notes that absence of dynamic, major-league-ready prospects is forcing spending spree.
lead_paragraph: The most rational way to rebuild the Yankees is to reconstruct a skeletal farm system, but with a deal near for the free-agent outfielder Jacoby Ellsbury, there seems to be no other option than to spend big.

headline.main: A Rich Fix in the Spirit of Steinbrenner
headline.print_headline: A Rich Fix In the Spirit Of Steinbrenner
